subject: statistics
title: Student's t-Distribution
contentHtml:
The Student's t-distribution is a probability distribution that arises when estimating population parameters based on a random sample from a normally distributed population.

  • It's commonly used in statistical hypothesis testing and confidence intervals.
name: Student's t-statistic" },
problemHtml: Suppose we want to estimate the mean height of a population based on a random sample of 25 students. If the sample mean is 175 cm and the standard deviation is 5 cm, what is the value of the t-statistic assuming a known population standard deviation?
description: Plug in values to calculate the t-statistic
explanation: This represents how many standard errors our sample mean is away from the expected value" } ],
finalAnswer: The value of the t-statistic is 10." },
intuition: The Student's t-distribution provides a way to quantify the uncertainty in our estimate, taking into account both the variability within the sample and the distance between the sample mean and the known population mean.

subject: statistics
title: Student's t-Distribution
contentHtml:
The Student's t-distribution is a continuous probability distribution that arises in statistical hypothesis testing and confidence intervals.

It is used to model the distribution of sample means when the population standard deviation is unknown or when the sample size is small.
name: Student's t-statistic" },
problemHtml: Suppose we want to test the mean of a population given a sample of size 10 with a sample mean of 5.2 and standard deviation of 1.3.
steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Calculate the sample mean", "mathHtml": "\(\bar{x} = \frac{52}{10}\)", "explanation": "We calculate the sample mean by summing up all values and dividing by the sample size."}, {"stepNumber": 2, "description": "Calculate the standard error", "mathHtml": "\(s/\sqrt{n} = 1.3 / \sqrt{10}\)", "explanation": "The standard error is calculated as the sample standard deviation divided by the square root of the sample size."} ],
intuition: The Student's t-distribution provides a way to account for uncertainty in the population mean when the sample size is small.
realWorldApplications: In machine learning, the Student's t-distribution is used as a prior distribution for model parameters.

subject: statistics
title: Student's t-Distribution
contentHtml:
The Student's t-distribution is a continuous probability distribution that arises in statistical inference when estimating population means.

It's particularly useful for comparing sample means to a known population mean, or for testing hypotheses about the mean of a normally distributed population.
name: Student's t-statistic" },
problemHtml: Suppose we want to test whether the average height of a random sample of students is different from the known population mean. We collect a sample of size 25 and calculate the sample mean to be 175 cm.

steps.explanation: We use this to estimate the population standard deviation
This measures how many standard deviations away our sample mean is from the population mean

intuition: The Student's t-distribution provides a way to account for uncertainty in the sample mean, allowing us to make more accurate inferences about the population mean.
realWorldApplications: Comparing sample means in A/B testing
